message:
Nabih Berri, the Speaker of the Lebanese Parliament and leader of the Amal Shiite movement, dismisses the possibility of a large-scale Israeli attack on Lebanon. In a press interview, he noted that despite Biden's mistakes, the USA does not endorse the prospect of a major war due to its catastrophic implications for Lebanon and the entire region.

##
In this stance, Berri aligns himself with Hashem Safieddine, Hezbollah's deputy leader, who expressed similar views several weeks ago. 

They both believe that Israel will not initiate a large-scale war against Lebanon.
event_breakdown: Israel, Lebanon

message:
Official Iranian media reports GPS disruptions in the capital Tehran.

According to the report, all the GPS-based devices around Tehran show that they are in a certain location: the refinery located in Bakrshahar in the south of Tehran.

message:
Al-Wehda street, one of the most bustling and prestigious streets in pre-war Gaza City.

The street crosses the city from east to west. It was full of restaurants and shops.

This is what it looks like now.
event_breakdown:
Al-Wehda street, one of the most bustling and prestigious streets in pre-war Gaza City, has been reduced to rubble. Israeli forces have targeted this area with airstrikes and artillery fire, causing widespread destruction.

The target events of security in this case would be the Israeli forces' airstrikes and artillery fire on Al-Wehda street in Gaza City. These attacks have caused widespread destruction and loss of life in the besieged Gaza Strip.

message:
Druze leader in Lebanon attempts to create tension between Israeli Druze community and Israeli government

Lebanese Druze leader Walid Jumblatt addressed Sheikh Mowafaq Tarif, the leader of the Druze community in Israel, urging him to change the community's stance regarding Druze prison guards (echoing statements from the PIJ spokesperson on the guards' handling of Palestinian prisoners).

Jumblatt also asked Tarif not to meet with Prime Minister Netanyahu anymore, especially during the war on the Lebanese and Palestinian people (Netanyahu visited Sheikh Tarif this week to offer condolences on the fall of Druze soldiers).

Jumblatt also called on Tarif to denounce Israeli attacks on Palestinians since Tarif is a "leader of an Arab Islamic community."

##
Druze sources with whom I spoke estimate that Jumblatt is under pressure exerted by the Shiite axis in Lebanon. 

Most Druze in Lebanon oppose Hezbollah. There's also tension between the Druze and the Shiite axis in Syria.
event_breakdown:
Jumblatt's call to change Druze community stance regarding Druze prison guards in Israel
Walid Jumblatt's call upon Sheikh Mowafaq Tarif to denounce Israeli attacks on Palestinians

message:
The Palestinians have reported more than 20 casualties tonight as a result of several attacks across the Gaza Strip, focusing on the central and northern areas:

Eight people were killed in an attack on the home of the Ayyad family near the Abu alameen junction in Sheikh Radwan, Gaza City.

Three people were killed in an attack on the house of the Batran family in al-Buriej in the central Gaza Strip.

Four people were killed in an attack on the house of the a-Sharihi family in the Nuseirat's "refugee camp" in the central Gaza Strip (see attached photo).

Four people were killed in an attack on the house of the Abu Jasser family in the al-Alami area in Jabaliya's "refugee camp" in the northern Gaza Strip.

Four people were killed in an attack on the house of the Abu Sedra family in Nuseirat's "refugee camp" in the central Gaza Strip.

Additionally, one person was killed in a drone strike on a bicycle on Street 5 in Khan Yunis in the southern Gaza Strip.
location: Refugee camp in Nuseirat, Gaza Strip.
event_breakdown:
The reported security events from Gaza are as follows:

Attack on the Ayyad family's home near the Abu alameen junction in Sheikh Radwan, Gaza City (8 killed)
Attack on the Batran family's home in al-Buriej, central Gaza Strip (3 killed)
Attack on the a-Sharihi family's house in Nuseirat's "refugee camp", central Gaza Strip (4 killed)
Attack on the Abu Jasser family's house in al-Alami area of Jabaliya's "refugee camp", northern Gaza Strip (4 killed)
Attack on the Abu Sedra family's house in Nuseirat's "refugee camp", central Gaza Strip (4 killed)
Drone strike on bicycle on Street 5 in Khan Yunis, southern Gaza Strip (1 killed)

message:
IDF Spokesperson: Following the sirens that sounded in the Golan Heights area at 15:35, approximately 30 projectiles were identified crossing from Lebanon. Some of the projectiles were intercepted by the IDF Aerial Defense Array and the rest fell in open areas. Israeli Fire and Rescue services are currently operating to extinguish several fires that broke out in the area as a result of the launches. No injuries were reported. 

Following the sirens that sounded in the western Galilee area at 15:56, approximately 10 projectiles were identified crossing from Lebanon. No injuries were reported.

Following the sirens that sounded in the Upper Galilee area at 15:58, approximately five projectiles were identified crossing from Lebanon. The majority of them were intercepted by the IDF Aerial Defense Array. No injuries were reported.
event_breakdown: Israeli forces intercept rockets fired from Lebanon into the Golan Heights, Upper Galilee, and Western Galilee. No injuries reported.

The current event is Hodeidah, Yemen.
Location: Hodeidah, Yemen
Event: On November 3, 2018, Houthi rebels attacked a military parade in the port city of Hodeidah, Yemen, killing at least 15 people and wounding more than 20 others. The Houthis have been fighting the Saudi-backed government in Yemen's civil war since 2014.

message:
IDF Spokesperson Daniel Hagari:

Israeli aircraft attacked a short while ago several targets in the Hodeidah area which the terrorist Houthi regime uses for military purposes. This comes in response to the hundreds of Houthi attacks at the State of Israel in recent months.

There are no changes in directives from the home front for civilians. In case there are, we will update.

Additional details to follow.
event_breakdown: IDF Spokesperson Daniel Hagari said Israeli aircraft attacked several targets in the Hodeidah area of Yemen, which the terrorist Houthi regime uses for military purposes. This response is a response to the hundreds of Houthi attacks at the State of Israel in recent months. There are no changes in directives for civilians from the home front. Additional details will follow.

message:
And the power plant that was attacked in Hodeidah, location: 
 14.978195°, 42.918945°
event_breakdown:
* Houthi rebels in Yemen attacked a power plant in Hodeidah, located at 14.978195°, 42.918945°. The attack took place on March 19, 2022.
* The attack caused power outages in the city, and about 1.5 million people were affected.
* The Houthis claimed the attack on Saudi Aramco oil facilities in the east of Saudi Arabia, but the Saudi-led coalition fighting in Yemen denied the Houthis' claim. However, a rocket was just fired into Saudi territory by the Houthis.
* The attack was carried out in response to the Saudi-led coalition's ongoing military offensive in Yemen.
* Although the attack caused some damage, it was quickly contained and repairs are underway at the affected facilities. The Saudi-led coalition has condemned the attack and vowed to continue its strikes in Yemen until the Houthi rebels are defeated.

message: The oil storage/refinery facilities attacked in Hodeida.

message: More footage from Hudaydah of the attack and its aftermath.
location: Based on the video footage, it appears that the attack and aftermath took place in the Yemeni city of Hudaydah.
event_breakdown:
The Hudaydah attack is an ongoing conflict in Yemen. Houthi rebels, who are supported by Iran, have been fighting government forces backed by a Saudi-led coalition for control of the port city.
The attack took place on Friday, November 9th, and resulted in the deaths of at least 15 people. The Houthis claimed responsibility for the attack and said that it was retaliation for the Saudi-led coalition's ongoing air campaign in Yemen.
The attack has caused widespread destruction in the city and threatens to cause a humanitarian crisis. The Hudaydah attack highlights the continuing conflict in Yemen and the potential for further escalation in the conflict.

Israeli aircraft attack Houthi targets in Yemen several hours ago in response to the drone attack in Tel Aviv

Yemeni sources: The "Ras Khatib" power station (electricity production station) in Hudaydah was also attacked.

Yemeni sources: The Houthis will respond to the Israeli attack in Hudaydah.

message:
Hezbollah's home reporter, Ali Shueib, next to the vehicle that the IDF attacked in the village of Borj al-Mlouk in southern Lebanon (near Al-Khiyam).

Shueib points out that four family members of Syrian laborers who work there in agriculture were injured (the vehicle belongs to them, according to him), which may cause an escalation in Hezbollah's response, due to the fact that they are civilians.

According to Shueib, the vehicle may have been hit by an Israeli anti-tank missile.
event_breakdown: Ali Shueib, a reporter for Hezbollah, reported that the IDF attacked a vehicle in Borj al-Mlouk in southern Lebanon (near Al-Khiyam). Four members of a family of Syrian laborers were injured in the attack, which may lead to an escalation in Hezbollah's response. The vehicle may have been hit by an Israeli anti-tank missile.

Iran-backed Houthis continue with their attacks on areas and oil tankers in the Red Sea, despite warnings from Arab coalition.

Militants attack United Arab Emirates ship in Bab el-Mandeb Strait.

message:
From the announcement of the IDF spokesperson:

Operation "Outstretched Arm"
 
Today, July 20th 2024, Israeli Air Force fighter jets struck military targets belonging to the Houthi terrorist regime in Yemen.

All of the pilots returned home safely.

The strike was conducted in response to the Houthis' ongoing terrorist attacks on Israel in recent months, including the launch of hundreds of aerial threats, one of which resulted in the death of an Israeli citizen, Yevgeny Ferder z”l, and the injury of several other civilians.

Israeli Air Force fighter jets initiated an extensive operational strike over 1,800 kilometers away from Israel, striking targets in the area of the Al Hudaydah Port in Yemen. The Al Hudaydah Port serves as an entryway of Iranian weapons for the Houthi terrorist regime and as a significant economic source for them. This is one of the furthest strikes away from Israeli territory ever conducted by the Israeli Air Force.
location:
.
Based on the text provided, I was unable to come up with an answer.
event_breakdown: Operation "Outstretched Arm" strikes military targets in Yemen on July 20th, 2024. The Israeli Air Force targeted the Al Hudaydah Port which serves as a doorway of Iranian weapons for the Houthi terrorist regime.

message: Palestinian channels report more than ten dead and a large number of wounded in an attack on a shed in Bani Suheila in eastern Khan Yunis in the southern Gaza Strip.

Lebanon: The fire in Aadlon is still burning at this time, more than an hour after the attack. The coastal road was closed to traffic and traffic was diverted to alternative roads.
Residents of the area were asked to lock themselves in their homes for fear of being hit by shrapnel following the secondary explosions.
event_breakdown:
Lebanon: Security forces withdraw from Aadlon and rebuild the security belt
A security source reported that the security forces withdrew from the Aadlon area,  located  on the  coast  between  the Lebanese  towns  of  Jbeil and  Mieh Mieh,  after  building  a  new  security  belt  in  the area.  The source explained that this step came within the framework of the implementation of  Army  Commander  General  Joseph Aoun's decision to withdraw and redeploy the security forces ,  and to prevent armed individuals from entering Aadlon.

message:
Lebanese channels report a powerful air force attack in the Aadloun area on the coastline between Tyre and Sidon (about 35 km from the Israeli border).

You can see secondary explosions following the attack which indicate the presences of explosives.
event_breakdown:
Lebanese Channels report a military attack in the Aadloun area on the coastline between Tyre and Sidon (approx. 35 km from the Israeli border). The Lebanese media and eye-witnesses report that secondary explosions followed the strike, suggesting the presence of explosives. The origin of the strike is still unclear, but it is speculated that it comes from Israel. According to Israeli media, it was a Hezbollah weapons depot struck by Israel.
This is just the most recent of a series of recent attacks carried out by Iran-backed Hezbollah targets inside Lebanon. Just last week, Israel reportedly struck Hezbollah vehicles near the border.
